byline.contributor: Farah Samti reported from Sousse, and Carlotta Gall from London. Reporting was contributed by David D. Kirkpatrick and Merna Thomas from Cairo, Melissa Eddy from Berlin and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By FARAH SAMTI and CARLOTTA GALL

abstract: Gunman disguised as vacationer kills at least 38 people at Imperial Marhaba Hotel in Sousse, Tunisia, before being shot dead by police officers; most of dead were British tourists; terrorist attack is one of worst in Tunisian history, and Islamic State claims responsibility.
lead_paragraph: Many of the victims were foreigners, in the second major terrorist attack on Tunisia’s tourism industry in a little more than three months.

headline.main: Tunisia Attack Kills at Least 38 at Beach Resort Hotel
headline.print_headline: Scores Die in Attack at Tunisian Beach Hotel

snippet: Many of the victims were foreigners, in the second major terrorist attack on Tunisia’s tourism industry in a little more than three months.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
